unnormalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the World of Film Festivals
normalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the World of Film Festivals

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk movies. But not just any movies – we're diving into the vibrant and sometimes chaotic world of film festivals. Think of it as a mela for movie buffs, a place where indie darlings rub shoulders with established stars, and where you can discover your next favourite film before anyone else.
normalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk movies. But not just any movies – we're diving into the vibrant and sometimes chaotic world of film festivals. Think of it as a mela for movie buffs, a place where indie darlings rub shoulders with established stars, and where you can discover your next favourite film before anyone else.

unnormalised: Now, you might be thinking, "Film festivals? Sounds a bit…artsy." And yeah, some are super niche, focusing on documentaries about rare Amazonian frogs or avant-garde animation. But others, like the Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival, are huge celebrations with something for everyone. I remember attending MAMI back in 2018, and it was a total sensory overload in the best way possible. So many films, so little time!
normalised: Now, you might be thinking, "Film festivals? Sounds a bit…artsy." And yeah, some are super niche, focusing on documentaries about rare Amazonian frogs or avant-garde animation. But others, like the Jio M A M I Mumbai Film Festival, are huge celebrations with something for everyone. I remember attending M A M I back in two thousand and eighteen, and it was a total sensory overload in the best way possible. So many films, so little time!

unnormalised: Why should you consider attending a film festival? Well, for starters, you get to see films you won't find in your local multiplex. Independent films, international cinema, short films… it’s a buffet of cinematic delights. Imagine seeing the next "Gully Boy" before it becomes a national sensation.

Independent films, international cinema, short films… it’s a buffet of cinematic delights. Imagine seeing the next "Gully Boy" before it becomes a national sensation.

unnormalised: Plus, it's a great way to network! Aspiring filmmakers can meet producers, writers can connect with directors, and cinephiles can simply gush about their favourite films with like-minded people. You might even bump into a Bollywood celebrity!
normalised: Plus, it's a great way to network! Aspiring filmmakers can meet producers, writers can connect with directors, and cinephiles can simply gush about their favourite films with like-minded people. You might even bump into a Bollywood celebrity!

unnormalised: Beyond the screenings, many festivals host Q&A sessions with filmmakers, workshops on scriptwriting, and parties that go on until the wee hours of the morning. Imagine discussing the nuances of Satyajit Ray's films with fellow enthusiasts over chai and samosas at 2 AM!
normalised: Beyond the screenings, many festivals host Q and A sessions with filmmakers, workshops on scriptwriting, and parties that go on until the wee hours of the morning. Imagine discussing the nuances of Satyajit Ray's films with fellow enthusiasts over chai and samosas at two A M!

unnormalised: Getting to one might involve a bit of travel. Maybe a train journey to Kolkata (Kolkata International Film Festival is a big deal!), or a flight to Goa for IFFI. Don't forget to factor in the costs – registration fees (sometimes around Rs. 2000), accommodation (hostels are your friend!), and those delicious street food snacks (Rs. 100 here, Rs. 50 there…it adds up!).

unnormalised: So, if you’re looking for an adventure that's both enriching and entertaining, consider adding a film festival to your bucket list. You might just discover your next cinematic obsession! And who knows, maybe I'll see you at MAMI next year!
